description: For the longest time i've had to use only wine games through bottles in order to get a coherent gaming experience that fit well into the gnome ecosystem (yes i know lutris + adw-gtk3 gets close, but it isn't gtk4+libadwaita) but finally those days are over! Cartriges allows for importing and manually adding linux native and wine games into one library. Now all thats left are emulator...
summary: Finally, a game manager for gnome!

description: Amazing UI and it allows me to run my games from Bottles, Heroic, and Steam.

Nice, simple interface that brings all your game libraries to one place. The only "issues" I had were that there's no way to automatically import from a steam library on a secondary drive so I had to add them all manually, which is mildly annoying as that's where 90% of my games are, and the lack of controller support since I feel this could be a great interface for playing games on a tv if that were added. Anyways, I'm kinda nitpicking here. It's a really good app and I hope it keeps getting developed.
Thank you for your effort.
Very clean, easy to setup
Nonetheless, thank you for making it, never had an issue, looks good and functions well- I can add every game besides minecraft (since the launcher I use is a flatpak).
summary: Is it a bit sad that this is my dream app?

description: A very nice and clean launcher
Perfectly fits with GNOME. Very useful.
summary: A simple yet wonderful game launcher

description: A clean shelf for my games, with no additional configurations to ever worry about. All while looking incredible!

Does a great job as a launcher for all launchers. 
It's simpler but more reliable than Windows-only GOG Galaxy 2.0.
A slick, straightfoward way to show your installed games, with no extra configuration needed. Exactly what I was looking for!

Get yourself an SteamGridDB API Key and activate Prefer Animated Images in Preferences. This is actually beautiful.


(adding an option to scale covers would make it perfect tho)

Works very easily with steam, lutris and bottles
it is very well integrated with gnome design guidelines
Having all games at one place with just a click. What else do I need!
summary: Great app with fast and awesome UX

description: Only problem I had with it is with bottles games that won't launch.
summary: Really good and fits really well with gnome

description:
big boi fast

yes
summary: Game launcher in GTK4 & libadwaita go BRRRRRR

description: Everything is automated and working Great!

An excellent app that unifies your entire collection of games, regardless of their platform. From games on Steam or GOG, to games from multiple emulators on your computer, everything is put together neatly in a simple and aesthetically pleasing assortment.
summary: Everything neatly put together in one place

description: Wow this is awesome. It just works with no fuzz. Love it!
All my games in a single nifty place. It lets you customized launching parameters as well so that its pretty handy.

superbe application libadwaita qui permet de centraliser ses jaquettes et de lancer ses jeux d'une bien jolie manière, le seul ajout qui serait le bienvenu serait un support de la navigation avec une manette et ça serait irréprochable !
Bravo, très pratique une fois épinglé en raccourci !
Good program in Gnome style
